item.title: Self Advocacy at a Remote-First Company: How to Careermax
item.description: Over the past couple of years at GitHub, I’ve learned that nothing in corporate is handed to you; you should always be your own biggest advocate. Promotions, good projects, and visibility are only unlocked when you have eyes on you. As they say, only the squeaky wheel gets grease. Getting visibility is never easy, but it can be even more difficult at a remote-first company where it’s harder to physically network.
